get.description: Gets a list of all `Branch` objects.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Branch` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

ParentGroupName.description: Parent company that owns or partially owns subsidiary organisations.

ParentGroupID.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a financial institution, as assigned under an internationally recognised or proprietary identification scheme

BrandName.description: Name by which an organisation is known that is printed on top of the ATM

BrandID.description: Unique and unambiguous way to identify the organisation that is shown on top of the ATM

BranchName.description: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party

BranchIdentification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a retail branch of a financial institution

BranchType.description: Information on the type of branch

StrtNm.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare

buidingNameOrNumber.description: Number or Name that identifies the position of a building on a street

PstCd.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail

TwnNm.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government

CtrySubDvsn.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county

TelephoneNumber.description: Collection of information that identifies a phone number, as defined by telecom services.

AlternativeTelephoneNumber.description: Collection of information that identifies a phone number, as defined by telecom services.

FaxNumber.description: Collection of information that identifies a FAX number, as defined by telecom services.

items.description: Collection of information that identifies a phone number, as defined by telecom services.

Lat.description: Latitude measured in degrees, minutes and seconds, following by 'N' for North and 'S' for South of the Equator (for example 48°51'29'' N for the Eiffel Tower latitude)

Long.description: Angular measurement of the distance of a location on the Earth East or West of the Greenwich Observatory. The longitude is measured in degrees, minutes and seconds, following by 'E' for East and 'W' for West (for example 2°17'4'' E for the Eiffel Tower longitude)

DaysOfTheWeek.description: Number of days that the mobile branch is available

StopName.description: Name of the stop of the mobile branch

ArrivalTime.description: Arrival time of the mobile branch

DepartureTime.description: Departure time of the mobile branch

ParkingLocation.description: Parking place of the mobile branch

StartDate.description: Date when a branch is due to close temporarily or permanently

EndDate.description: Date when a branch is due to re-open following temporary closure

items.description: Information about self service branch services
enum: Cash and Cheque Deposit Machine (No Coin)

BranchSelfServeServiceDescription.description: Additional information about self service branch services

BranchMediatedServiceDescription.description: Additional information about mediated branch facilities, such as waiting areas with seats available for business banking (if waiting)

CustomerSegment.description: Customer segment which the branch is able to service

items.description: Customer segment which the branch is able to service

BranchFacilitiesDescription.description: Additional information about branch facilities, such as specific lights

ATMAtBranch.description: Indicated whether an ATM is at the branch

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

get.description: Gets a list of all `Personal Current Account` objects.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Personal Current Account` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

ParentGroupName.description: Parent company that owns or partially owns subsidiary organisations

ParentGroupID.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a financial institution, as assigned under an internationally recognised or proprietary identification scheme

BrandName.description: Name by which an organisation is known that is printed on top of the ATM

BrandID.description: Unique and unambiguous way to identify the organisation that is shown on top of the ATM

ProductType.description: Descriptive code for the product category

ProductName.description: The name of the product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. i.e. what the customer would recognise

items.description: Marketing or industry segment that the product is designed for

InternationalPaymentsSupported.description: Indicates that the account supports international payments

ProductIdentifier.description: Identifier within the parent organisation for the product. Must be unique in the organisation

CardWithdrawalLimit.description: The daily Limit that a customer can get via the ATM. This describes the default limit rather than the maximum

ProductDescription.description: Description of the product provided by the parent organisation

TsandCs.description: URL provided by the parent organisation which redirects to the current T&Cs

AccessChannels.description: Ways to interact with the bank when managing account

Contactless.description: Does the card issued have contactless facility

MobileWallet.description: Mobile wallet supported by this product. A mobile wallet being any electronic device that allows an individual to make electronic commerce transactions

CardNotes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the card details

CreditScoringPartOfAccountOpeningForGett.description: Indicates whether a credit check performed on an inquiry to open an account is submitted

CreditScoringPartOfAccountOpeningIsAHard.description: Describes the type of credit scoring

CreditScoringPartOfAccountOpeningText.description: Details on the specific credit scoring

CreditScoringPartOfAccountOpeningForIDVe.description: Indicates whether a credit check is used to check the address of a potential new account holder

CreditScoringPartOfAccountOpeningIDVerif.description: Details on the specific credit scoring

MonthlyMaximumCharge.description: The maximum Relevant Charges that could accrue in relation to that PCA in any month as a result of exceeding or attempting to exceed a Pre-agreed credit limit on the PCA. i.e. it does not include any charges that are applied through the normal operation of the account such as overdraft interest charges whilst within an agreed limit

ProductURL.description: URL provided by the organisation which redirects to the product (on live products only). There might be more than one product at a given URL

Ccy.description: Currency of the Account. Default to GBP at present

items.description: Active or Historic Currency Code and Amount

OverdraftOffered.description: Indicates whether an overdraft offered for this account

ProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

ExchangeRateAdjustment.description: The margin added, by certain card issuers, to the scheme rate in order to arrive at the exchange rate qouted as the reference exchange rate to the cardholder

AgeRestricted.description: Indicates a customer's age is part of eligibility criteria

MinimumAge.description: Minimum age, in years, required to hold an account

MaximumAge.description: Maximum age, in years, allowed to hold the account

MaximumAgeToOpen.description: Maximum age, in years, to open an account

OtherFinancialHoldingRequired.description: Indicates that it is necessary to hold another product with the bank in order to be eligible for this product or feature

IncomeTurnoverRelated.description: Indicates if eligibility linked to income

SingleJointIncome.description: Minimum Income Source. For certain products a minimum income is required. This can be mandated as to the single income or to a joint income. This field describes this

MinimumIncomeTurnoverAmount.description: Minimum income / Turnover required to hold the product

IncomeCondition.description: Stipulates any particular definition of income that applies to the income eligibility and/or method by which income must paid into the account (eg Salary DD)

MinIncomeTurnoverPaidIntoAccount.description: Minimum Income Amount required to paid into the account

MinimumIncomeFrequency.description: The frequency that the minimum mentioned before is deposited in the account. Yearly is very important for premium accounts

ResidencyResticted.description: Indicates a customer's residency forms part of the eligibility criteria

ResidencyRestictedRegion.description: Indicates a customer must be current resident of a geographic area/country

MaxNumberOfAccounts.description: Maximum number of the same prodcut the customer may hold

ThirdSectorOrganisations.description: Is the product available to operate as a Clubs or Societies account?

MinimumDeposit.description: A minimum deposit required to hold this account

OpeningDepositMinimum.description: Minimum Amount to be held on account

OpeningDepositMinimumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening

MinimumOperatingBalanceExists.description: Is there a Minimum Operating Balance?

MaximumOpeningAmount.description: A maximum amount to be deposited at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumAmount.description: Maximum Amount to be depositing at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening

EligibilityName.description: Free text description, denotes non standard eligibilities not included in the code list

enum: Arrears on Loan, Credit Card, mortgage
Over Overdraft for more than 30 days
Date Limited (2 months within course start date)

EligibilityNotes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the eligibility conditions. Only used for very specific conditions

PreviousBancruptcy.description: Describes if a previous bankruptcy / insolvency disqualfies for this account Details in ELI-280

CreditCharged.description: Is credit paid to the account. The answer will be the condition of all other fields to be filled

InterestSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

StartDate.description: If interest is charged on a specific date range as start date (often used for promotion)

EndDate.description: If interest is charged on a specific date range as end date (often used for promotion)

CalculationFrequency.description: How often is interest applied to account

Rate.description: Rate being paid by the bank (gross)

AprAERRate.description: AER or APR Rate for comparison

InterestNotes.description: Additional notes to supplement the interest details

InterestProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

InterestTierSME.description: Identifier for tier only where it has been supplied under Part 8 (article 32 or the CMA order), value reflects upper tier value

InterestNotes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the interest details

TotalOverdraftChargeAmount.description: All charges that a customer could incur as a result of exceeding or attempting to exceed a Pre-agreed credit limit

MinUnarrangedOverdraftAmount.description: Minimum Unarranged Overdraft Amount if applicable

InterestRateCalculationFrequency.description: Frequency at which interest is calculated and accrued

OtherCharge.description: Other flat charge levied when overdrawn (Arranged)

RatesAreNegotionable.description: Value that expresses if the rates are negotiable

IndicativeRate.description: Indicative Rate that the client will get

BufferAmount.description: Amount on overdraft that is prearranged

Term.description: The duration of the overdraft, if it is non permanent

SetUpFeesAmount.description: Fees to set up the overdraft

SetUpFeesRate.description: Rate to set up the overdraft

AnnualRenewalFee.description: Fee payable per term for overdraft

ProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

FeeLowerTier.description: Lower occurrence / range boundary e.g.. For returned cheques this could be 0, which means the first returned cheque fits into this range

FeeHigherTier.description: Higher occurrence / range boundary e.g. For returned cheques this could be 10, which means the first 10 returned cheque fits into this range

FeeType.description: A description of the Fee type
enum: Foreign Currency Withdrawal Fee (% of Tx - Min £2 - Max £5)
Sterling Travellers Cheque (% of Tx - Min £2 - Max £5)
Credits paid in via night Safe
Credit paid In via Depos ATM
Automated credit - Telephone and Internet Banking
Transfer to an account outside of the group
Cash paid out at own counter
Credit paid in at another bank
Credit paid in via Night Safe - up to £5K
Electronic payments received from abroad Up to £100
Electronic payments received from abroad over £100
Cheques/drafts (including dividend warrants) payable in foreign currency or Sterling drawn abroad
Cheques/drafts (including dividend warrants) payable in foreign currency drawn in the UK
Unpaid charge (if the cheque/draft is not honoured by the paying bank)
Status enquiries abroad (if sent electronically) additional
After an international payment has been sent abroad - Beneficiary claiming non-receipt of funds (BCNR)
After an international payment has been sent abroad - Recalling a payment
First legal mortgage over a property, such as business premises
Second or subsequent legal mortgage over a property, such as a house or business premises
One time payment at the start of the loan

Negotiable.description: Indicates that this Fee Rate or Fee Amount is negotiable based on risk or other factor

FeeLowerTier.description: Lower occurrence / range boundary e.g. For returned cheques this could be 0, which means the first returned cheque fits into this range

FeeHigherTier.description: Higher occurrence / range boundary e.g. For returned cheques this could be 10, which means the first 10 returned cheque fits into this range

FeesAndChargesNotes.description: Supplementary information for fees and charges

Benefit.description: Describe  one or more benefits if they exist

BenefitSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date in days

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

BenefitType.description: Type that represents the nature of the benefit

BenefitValue.description: The value or values permissible for a specific benefit for an individual product representing a product characteristic

DefaultToAccounts.description: Is the benefit part of the default account

CriteriaType.description: Criteria that is required in order to be eligible for the Benefit

Counter.description: Counter for the criteria (e.g. number of DD)

BenefitDescription.description: A textual explanation of what the benefit is

PromotionStartDate.description: If the benefit is temporal the start date is when the benefit comes into effect

PromotionEndDate.description: If the benefit is temporal the end date is when the benefit is no longer applicable

InterestTierSME.description: Identifier for tier only where it has been supplied under Part 8 (article 32 or the CMA order), value reflects upper tier value

InterestNotes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the interest details

TotalOverdraftChargeAmount.description: All charges that a customer could incur as a result of exceeding or attempting to exceed a Pre-agreed credit limit

MinUnarrangedOverdraftAmount.description: Minimum Unarranged Overdraft Amount if applicable

InterestRateCalculationFrequency.description: Frequency at which interest is calculated and accrued

OtherCharge.description: Other flat charge levied when overdrawn (Arranged)

RatesAreNegotionable.description: Value that expresses if the rates are negotiable

IndicativeRate.description: Indicative Rate that the client will get

BufferAmount.description: Amount on overdraft that is prearranged

Term.description: The duration of the overdraft, if it is non permanent

SetUpFeesAmount.description: Fees to set up the overdraft

SetUpFeesRate.description: Rate to set up the overdraft

AnnualRenewalFee.description: Fee payable per term for overdraft

ProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

FeeLowerTier.description: Lower occurrence / range boundary e.g.. For returned cheques this could be 0, which means the first returned cheque fits into this range

FeeHigherTier.description: Higher occurrence / range boundary e.g. For returned cheques this could be 10, which means the first 10 returned cheque fits into this range

FeeType.description: A description of the Fee type
enum: Foreign Currency Withdrawal Fee (% of Tx - Min £2 - Max £5)
Sterling Travellers Cheque (% of Tx - Min £2 - Max £5)
Credits paid in via night Safe
Credit paid In via Depos ATM
Automated credit - Telephone and Internet Banking
Transfer to an account outside of the group
Cash paid out at own counter
Credit paid in at another bank
Credit paid in via Night Safe - up to £5K
Electronic payments received from abroad Up to £100
Electronic payments received from abroad over £100
Cheques/drafts (including dividend warrants) payable in foreign currency or Sterling drawn abroad
Cheques/drafts (including dividend warrants) payable in foreign currency drawn in the UK
Unpaid charge (if the cheque/draft is not honoured by the paying bank)
Status enquiries abroad (if sent electronically) additional
After an international payment has been sent abroad - Beneficiary claiming non-receipt of funds (BCNR)
After an international payment has been sent abroad - Recalling a payment
First legal mortgage over a property, such as business premises
Second or subsequent legal mortgage over a property, such as a house or business premises
One time payment at the start of the loan

Negotiable.description: Indicates that this Fee Rate or Fee Amount is negotiable based on risk or other factor

FeeHigherTier.description: Higher occurrence / range boundary e.g. For returned cheques this could be 10, which means the first 10 returned cheque fits into this range

DefaultToAccounts.description: Is the benefit part of the default account

CriteriaType.description: Criteria that is required in order to be eligible for the Benefit

Counter.description: Counter for the criteria (e.g. number of DD)

head.description: Gets header information on the current set of `Business Current Account` data

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

get.description: Gets a list of all `Unsercured SME Lending` objects.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Unsecured SME Lending` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

ParentGroupName.description: Parent company that owns or partially owns subsidiary organisations

ParentGroupID.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a financial institution, as assigned under an internationally recognised or proprietary identification scheme

BrandName.description: Name by which an organisation is known that is printed on top of the ATM

BrandID.description: Unique and unambiguous way to identify the organisation that is shown on top of the ATM

ProductName.description: The short product or marketing name assigned by the parent organisation

ProductTypeName.description: Descriptive code for the product category

ProductSegment.description: Marketing or industry segment that the product is applicable for. Gives the sector or segment that the Loan is designed for

ProductDescription.description: Description of the product provided by the parent Organisation

TsandCs.description: URL provided by the parent organisation which redirects to the T&Cs

CustomerAccessChannels.description: Ways to interact with the bank

Ccy.description: Currency of the Account. Default to GBP at present

items.description: Active or Historic Currency Code and Amount

PaymentHoliday.description: Indicates whether a repayment holiday is allowed

ProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

SizeIncrement.description: Identifier for tier only where it has been supplied under Part 8 (article 32 or the CMA order), value reflects upper tier value

AgeRestricted.description: Indicates a customer's age is part of eligibility criteria

MinimumAge.description: Minimum age, in years, required to hold an account

MaximumAge.description: Maximum age, in years, allowed to hold the account

MaximumAgeToOpen.description: Maximum age, in years, to open an account

OtherFinancialHoldingRequired.description: Indicates that it is necessary to hold another product with the bank in order to be eligible for this product or feature

IncomeTurnoverRelated.description: Indicates if eligibility linked to income

SingleJointIncome.description: Minimum Income Source. For certain products a minimum income is required. This can be mandated as to the single income or to a joint income. This field describes this

MinimumIncomeTurnoverAmount.description: Minimum income / Turnover required to hold the product

IncomeCondition.description: Stipulates any particular definition of income that applies to the income eligibility and/or method by which income must paid into the account (eg Salary DD)

MinIncomeTurnoverPaidIntoAccount.description: Minimum Income Amount required to paid into the account

MinimumIncomeFrequency.description: The frequency that the minimum mentioned before is deposited in the account. Yearly is very important for premium accounts

ResidencyResticted.description: Indicates a customer's residency forms part of the eligibility criteria

ResidencyRestictedRegion.description: Indicates a customer must be current resident of a geographic area/country

MaxNumberOfAccounts.description: Maximum number of the same prodcut the customer may hold

ThirdSectorOrganisations.description: Is the product available to operate as a Clubs or Societies account?

MinimumDeposit.description: A minimum deposit required to hold this account

OpeningDepositMinimum.description: Minimum Amount to be held on account

OpeningDepositMinimumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening

MinimumOperatingBalanceExists.description: Is there a Minimum Operating Balance?

MaximumOpeningAmount.description: A maximum amount to be deposited at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumAmount.description: Maximum Amount to be depositing at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening

EligibilityName.description: Free text description, denotes non standard eligibilities not included in the code list

enum: Arrears on Loan, Credit Card, mortgage
Over Overdraft for more than 30 days
Date Limited (2 months within course start date)

EligibilityNotes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the eligibility conditions. Only used for very specific conditions

PreviousBancruptcy.description: Describes if a previous bankruptcy / insolvency disqualfies for this account Details in ELI-280

get.description: Gets a list of all `Commerical Credit Card` objects.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The client application that is making the request

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional GET request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Commercial Credit Card` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

ParentGroupName.description: Parent company that owns or partially owns subsidiary organisations

ParentGroupID.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a financial institution, as assigned under an internationally recognised or proprietary identification scheme

BrandName.description: Name by which an organisation is known that is printed on top of the ATM

BrandID.description: Unique and unambiguous way to identify the organisation that is shown on top of the ATM

ProductName.description: Name of the Commercial Credit Card

ProductType.description: Descriptive code for the product category

ProductSegment.description: Marketing or industry segment that the product is designed for

items.description: Marketing or industry segment that the product is designed for

ProductIdentifier.description: Identifier within the parent organisation for the product. Must be unique in the organisation

PaymentHoliday.description: Indicates whether a payment holiday is possible

PaymentHolidayDescription.description: Detailed description on the payment holiday if available

TsandCs.description: URL provided by the parent organisation which redirects to the current T&Cs. Only applies on live products

ProductSubType.description: Describes if the offering is promotional, regular or a description of a future state

LengthPromotionalInDays.description: Describes the length if only a duration is given instead of a date

DateOfChange.description: Date of the change if it refers to future terms

BalanceTransferInterestRatePeriod.description: The period used to define the specific interest rate for balance transfers

OverLimitFee.description: Fee applicable if the card was credited over its limit

MaximumNumberOfCardsPermitted.description: The maximum numbers of cards per account

AbilityToSetIndividualLimits.description: The ability to set separate limts on different cards in one account

AccessToOnlineDataReportingTool.description: Describes whether the account have access to an online tool for reprting on expenditure

CashWithdrawalsAllowed.description: Describes whether cash withdrawals are allowed

ConvenienceCheque.description: Describes whether the card account allow convenience cheques

DaysInterestFreeCreditIfPaymentFull.description: Describes how many interest free days are given if the card is fully paid at each term

IssuingEmergencyCardsFees.description: Amount payable for issuing an emergency card

AnnualFeeAmount.description: Details on annual account fee, such as non payable when there is a turnover above a certain sum

CashbackPercent.description: Percent of cashback on amount spend

FeesOnCheque.description: Percentage fee on a convenince cheques

PaymentDaysAfterStatement.description: How many days after statement is the payment expected

StatementAtAccountLevel.description: Describes whether there is a statement at account level

StatementAtPersonalLevel.description: Describes whether there is a statement at card level

PaymentSchemeExchangeRate.description: The base exchange rate used in settlement of the transaction between issuer and scheme

ExchangeRateAdjustment.description: The margin added, by certain card issuers, to the scheme rate in order to arrive at the exchange rate qouted as the reference exchange rate to the cardholder

PaymentSchemeExchangeFee.description: Any payment network fee applied to some or all non-sterling transactions that the card issuer recover directly from the cardholder

PaymentSchemeExchangeFeeRate.description: Any payment network fee rate applied to some or all non-sterling transactions that the card issuer recover directly from the cardholder

NonSterlingTransactionFee.description: A fee applied to all non-Sterling card transactions

NonSterlingTransactionFeeRate.description: A fee rate applied to all non-Sterling card transactions

NonSterlingPurchaseFee.description: An additional fee applied to certain card retail transactions

NonSterlingPurchaseFeeRate.description: An additional fee rate applied to certain card retail transactions

NonSterlingCashFee.description: An additional fee applied to certain card cash withdrawals. This fee also applies to cash near fees such as gambling

NonSterlingCashFeeRate.description: An additional fee rate applied to certain card cash withdrawals. This fee also applies to cash near fees such as gambling

ForeignPurchaseFee.description: Additional card fee applied to sterling retail transactions made abroad

ForeignPurchaseFeeRate.description: Additional card fee rate applied to sterling retail transactions made abroad

ForeignCashFee.description: Additional card fee applied to sterling cash withdrawal made abroad

ForeignCashFeeRate.description: Additional card fee rate applied to sterling cash withdrawal made abroad

AgeRestricted.description: Indicates a customer's age is part of eligibility criteria

MinimumAge.description: Minimum age, in years, required to hold an account

MaximumAge.description: Maximum age, in years, allowed to hold the account

MaximumAgeToOpen.description: Maximum age, in years, to open an account

OtherFinancialHoldingRequired.description: Indicates that it is necessary to hold another product with the bank in order to be eligible for this product or feature

IncomeTurnoverRelated.description: Indicates if eligibility linked to income

SingleJointIncome.description: Minimum Income Source. For certain products a minimum income is required. This can be mandated as to the single income or to a joint income. This field describes this

MinimumIncomeTurnoverAmount.description: Minimum income / Turnover required to hold the product

IncomeCondition.description: Stipulates any particular definition of income that applies to the income eligibility and/or method by which income must paid into the account (eg Salary DD)

MinIncomeTurnoverPaidIntoAccount.description: Minimum Income Amount required to paid into the account

MinimumIncomeFrequency.description: The frequency that the minimum mentioned before is deposited in the account. Yearly is very important for premium accounts

ResidencyResticted.description: Indicates a customer's residency forms part of the eligibility criteria

ResidencyRestictedRegion.description: Indicates a customer must be current resident of a geographic area/country

MaxNumberOfAccounts.description: Maximum number of the same prodcut the customer may hold

ThirdSectorOrganisations.description: Is the product available to operate as a Clubs or Societies account?

MinimumDeposit.description: A minimum deposit required to hold this account

OpeningDepositMinimum.description: Minimum Amount to be held on account

OpeningDepositMinimumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening

MinimumOperatingBalanceExists.description: Is there a Minimum Operating Balance?

MaximumOpeningAmount.description: A maximum amount to be deposited at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumAmount.description: Maximum Amount to be depositing at opening

OpeningDepositMaximumCurrency.description: The currency of the Minimum Amount to be depositing at opening
